transcript_segments.text: Hello foodies, welcome to Wish My Food! Today’s special is Tamil Nadu’s famous Ambur Chicken Dum Biryani. This is a traditional Muslim recipe from Ambur, a town in Tamil Nadu. It’s rich in flavor and very spicy and tasty. The best part is that both the chicken and rice are cooked together in dum (steam). So, there’s no issue like undercooked chicken or hard rice.

Every time, it turns out to be a super hit recipe. Let’s start. First, take 2 cups (approx. 185g per cup) of Jeera rice. Add fennel seeds along with the rice. Wash the rice thoroughly once and soak it for some time, so that the aroma is retained.

instruction: Soak 10–12 dried red chillies in hot water for 10–15 minutes to soften them.
title: Soak Red Chillies

transcript_segments.text: In Ambur Chicken Biryani, the spice comes from red chilies alone. You need to use dried red chilies. Break them and soak them slightly. If you don’t have stone mortar, you can use a mixer.

instruction: Grind the soaked chillies into a smooth paste using minimal water.

transcript_segments.text: Grind into a smooth paste. Now take a biryani pot and heat 1/3 cup (approx. 80 ml) of oil. Once it’s hot, add 4 pieces of cinnamon stick and 4 cloves.

instruction: Add cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaf, and fennel seeds. Sauté until fragrant.

transcript_segments.text: Avoid using pre-ground spices. Whole spices give a better taste. Fry until the onions turn light golden brown. Then add 2 tablespoons of ginger-garlic paste.

instruction: Stir in ginger paste and garlic paste. Cook for 1–2 minutes until the raw smell disappears.

instruction: Stir in thick curd, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Cook for 2–3 minutes until well combined.

transcript_segments.text: Once it starts frying well, add 2 teaspoons of coriander powder. When the oil starts separating, add 1 kg of chicken cut into medium pieces. Cook until the chicken turns golden brown on medium flame.

It takes about 15 minutes for the chicken to get half-cooked. Always remember, after cleaning the chicken, it should remain inside the marinade for at least 30 minutes. That’s when chicken cooks perfectly during dum. Even chicken shop people know this.

instruction: Add cleaned mutton or chicken. Season with salt. Stir well to coat the meat with the masala.
title: Add Meat and Salt

transcript_segments.text: Once cooked, add 3 chopped tomatoes, 3 slit green chilies, enough salt, ½ cup (about 125 ml) whisked curd, 1½ tablespoons garam masala, and 1 cup (250 ml) water. Mix everything well.

instruction: Cover and cook the meat on medium heat until it is tender and oil begins to separate from the masala. Stir occasionally.

instruction: In a separate large pot, bring enough water to a boil. Add a pinch of salt.

When chicken is 90% cooked, take one cup of gravy out. Add 1 tablespoon lemon juice, a little chopped coriander and mint leaves, mix well, turn off the stove, and set it aside.

instruction: Add the soaked rice to boiling water and cook until it's about 80% cooked. The grains should be firm but cooked through.
title: Cook Rice Until 80% Done

transcript_segments.text: Into another pot, add 3 tablespoons of salt. Add the soaked rice into boiling water. Also, add 2 teaspoons of oil. Cook the rice up to 80% only. Everyone knows what 80% cooked rice looks like.

instruction: Drain the rice immediately using a colander and set aside.

After that, pour the reserved gravy over the rice. Then add the leftover rice water (starch water) over the biryani. Seal the pot with a lid and cook on low flame for 20 minutes.

instruction: Cover the pot tightly with a lid (use dough or foil for a better seal). Cook on a low flame for 15–20 minutes (dum cooking).
title: Seal and Dum Cook

transcript_segments.text: After that, pour the reserved gravy over the rice. Then add the leftover rice water (starch water) over the biryani. Seal the pot with a lid and cook on low flame for 20 minutes.

instruction: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest for 10 minutes before opening the lid.
title: Rest the Biryani

transcript_segments.text: After that, pour the reserved gravy over the rice. Then add the leftover rice water (starch water) over the biryani. Seal the pot with a lid and cook on low flame for 20 minutes.

instruction: Gently fluff and mix the biryani from the sides without breaking the rice. Serve hot with brinjal curry and raita.
title: Gently Mix and Serve

transcript_segments.text: After that, pour the reserved gravy over the rice. Then add the leftover rice water (starch water) over the biryani. Seal the pot with a lid and cook on low flame for 20 minutes.

After 20 minutes, check – it will look perfect. No need to do anything else. This is the perfect texture. At this stage, add 2 tablespoons of ghee, a little chopped coriander and mint, mix gently, and fluff the biryani slowly.
If it's crumbly, it’s like Hyderabadi biryani. But in Tamil Nadu biryani, the rice is softer. It should be soft enough to hold in a spoon without breaking. That’s the texture expected here.
